intro: Silene succulenta, commonly known as the succulent catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and stems, which help it store water in arid environments. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun. Silene succulenta is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
